reviews.review_msg: Tania as a person was incredibly sweet. However, as an educator I found them very hard to get along with and understand. Instructions and lectures were unclear. Deadlines were missed. Criteria for assignments were nearly impossible to understand. I found this class very sloppy and not structured. Again great person! Their learning style isnt for me

Interesting lecturer - rambles a bit, but nothing unmanageable and lectures only apply a bit to the two papers you need to write anyway. Get ready to read a lot to truly understand restorative justice and for the papers. Papers allow you to pick your own focus. Tutorials and TAs were awesome! Tutorials are basically two hours of fun games.

have Tania at KPU and she's great, she's young and relatable and the classes are structured in easy-to-chew ways. I would highly recommend, she makes topics that may be offensive educational and interesting to follow

One of the most caring profs at SFU. Very approachable and nice. T.A's were just as nice! I enjoyed learning about the RJ & doing worksheets on it weekly. Papers were super fun to write and tutorials were filled with new activities. There's no exams, which made it easier to learn. i would for sure take again!!!!

very passionate about RJ and showcases that through lectures, tutorials, and assignments. You don't have to show up to lecture, because there's no exams. There are 2 papers, worth 60%. There are weekly worksheets, but they are so much to do and basically free marks. Tutorials can be dragging, since it's 2 hours and filled with activities, but easy

Lectures and course materials hardly related to the two papers that make up 60% of the final grade. Tutorials are just two hours of icebreaker games with no reference to course material that can be used in assignments. Criteria for assignments are extremely vague and if they just don't like what you write, you'll lose marks.
Literally amazing teacher! Having her for 315, and she is so passionate about the topic its incredible. You actually want to be in her class.

Amazing TA. Really cares about her students and really wants to challenge them emotionally in this course. If you are scared to speak, this tutorial/class is NOT  for you because you are really pushed to your limits to share experiences in front of everyone. Tania makes it so comfortable though as if she is your friend - not your TA!

Tania was extremely unclear in her paper expectations, which was beyond frustrating. Her lectures were pointless to go to in that her slides merely covered the readings, without adding much else. That being said, way too much info on slides. Often would talk in circles, hence the lack of clarity. As a person, she is great. As a prof, not the best.

Tania failed to provide clear instructions. All Powerpoint were summarization from readings. Didn't add additional insight. Although Tania is an expert in RJ, she really dried it out for me, as RJ is something I am truly passionate about.
First.   Tania is amazing :)   True RJ prof, if anyone were to teach RJ she definitely qualifies for the job.  P.S. Would be friends with/date if wasn't my prof.
